metadata.title: Economic Model Validation Survey for Economists
metadata.data_usage: Responses will be used to refine economic model parameters. Individual responses are confidential.

introduction.overview: This survey validates the economic model for a proposed 1% Global Health Security Treaty that would redirect 1% of global military spending ($113.5B/year) to medical research and clinical trial infrastructure.
main_claims: 416 million lives saved over 50 years through accelerated drug development
Cost-effectiveness: $27 per DALY averted (3.3x better than bed nets at $89/DALY)
ROI: 450x return on R&D savings alone (10-year NPV, most conservative estimate)
Political feasibility: 1-10% success probability over 20 years
introduction.your_role: As an economist, you're being asked to validate the parameters, calculations, and assumptions underlying these claims. Your feedback will be used to refine the model and strengthen the economic case for the treaty.
survey_structure: Parameters are ordered by importance (sensitivity analysis + document usage frequency)
Within that ordering, inputs are validated before outputs that depend on them
Each parameter has 2-4 questions depending on its type (external/calculated/definition)
You can stop at any time - priority is given to high-impact parameters first
Some follow-up questions appear based on your responses (e.g., if you rate a source as low credibility, you'll be asked for alternatives)

time_horizons.lives_saved: 50-year cumulative impact (standard for disease eradication models)
time_horizons.note: Different parameters use different time horizons appropriate to their context. This will be specified in each parameter's description.

question_types.rating: 1-5 scale questions (e.g., credibility rating). Includes 'Not qualified to assess' option.
question_types.range: Enter lower and upper bounds (e.g., confidence intervals)

introduction.note: Your responses are confidential. We're seeking honest feedback to improve the model, not validation for pre-determined conclusions.

background_questions.text: Primary area(s) of expertise (check all that apply)
Years of professional experience in economics
Familiarity with DALY (Disability-Adjusted Life Years) methodology
Familiarity with NPV (Net Present Value) and ROI calculations

parameters.display_name: Bed Nets Cost per DALY
parameters.description: GiveWell cost per DALY for insecticide-treated bed nets (midpoint estimate, range $78-100). DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years) measure disease burden by combining years of life lost and years lived with disability. Bed nets prevent malaria deaths and are considered a gold standard benchmark for cost-effective global health interventions - if an intervention costs less per DALY than bed nets, it's exceptionally cost-effective. GiveWell synthesizes peer-reviewed academic research with transparent, rigorous methodology and extensive external expert review.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: GiveWell cost per DALY for insecticide-treated bed nets (midpoint estimate, range $78-100). DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years) measure disease burden by combining years of life lost and years lived with disability. Bed nets prevent malaria deaths and are considered a gold standard benchmark for cost-effective global health interventions - if an intervention costs less per DALY than bed nets, it's exceptionally cost-effective. GiveWell synthesizes peer-reviewed academic research with transparent, rigorous methodology and extensive external expert review.

DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years) measure disease burden by combining years of life lost and years lived with disability. Bed nets prevent malaria deaths and are considered a gold standard benchmark for cost-effective global health interventions - if an intervention costs less per DALY than bed nets, it's exceptionally cost-effective. GiveWell synthesizes peer-reviewed academic research with transparent, rigorous methodology and extensive external expert review.

parameters.display_name: Political Lobbying Campaign: Direct Lobbying, Super Pacs, Opposition Research, Staff, Legal/Compliance
parameters.description: Political lobbying campaign: direct lobbying (US/EU/G20), Super PACs, opposition research, staff, legal/compliance. Budget exceeds combined pharma ($300M/year) and military-industrial complex ($150M/year) lobbying to ensure competitive positioning. Referendum relies on grassroots mobilization and earned media, while lobbying requires matching or exceeding opposition spending for political viability.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

parameters.display_name: Reserve Fund / Contingency Buffer
parameters.description: Reserve fund / contingency buffer (5% of total campaign cost). Conservative estimate uses 5% given transparent budget allocation and predictable referendum/lobbying costs, though industry standard is 10-20% for complex campaigns. Upper confidence bound of $100M (10%) reflects potential for unforeseen legal challenges, opposition response, or regulatory delays.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

parameters.display_name: Total Deaths from Disease Eradication Delay
parameters.description: Total eventually avoidable deaths from delaying disease eradication by 8.2 years (PRIMARY estimate, conservative). Excludes fundamentally unavoidable deaths (primarily accidents ~7.9%).

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: Total eventually avoidable deaths from delaying disease eradication by 8.2 years (PRIMARY estimate, conservative). Excludes fundamentally unavoidable deaths (primarily accidents ~7.9%).
context_card.formula_readable: Annual Deaths × Regulatory Delay for Efficacy Testing Post-Safety Verification × Eventually Avoidable Death Percentage

questions.question_text:
Is the calculation methodology sound for: **Total Deaths from Disease Eradication Delay**?

**Current result:** 416M deaths deaths
**Calculation:** ANNUAL_DEATHS × 8.2 years × 92.6% = 416M deaths

context.formula_readable: Annual Deaths × Regulatory Delay for Efficacy Testing Post-Safety Verification × Eventually Avoidable Death Percentage

parameters.display_name: Cost per DALY Averted (Timeline Shift)
parameters.description: Cost per DALY averted from one-time timeline shift (8.2 years). This is a conservative estimate that only counts campaign cost ($1B) and ignores all economic benefits ($27B/year funding unlocked + $50B/year R&D savings). For comparison: bed nets cost $89.0/DALY, deworming costs $4-10/DALY. This intervention is 700x more cost-effective than bed nets while also being self-funding.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: Cost per DALY averted from one-time timeline shift (8.2 years). This is a conservative estimate that only counts campaign cost ($1B) and ignores all economic benefits ($27B/year funding unlocked + $50B/year R&D savings). For comparison: bed nets cost $89.0/DALY, deworming costs $4-10/DALY. This intervention is 700x more cost-effective than bed nets while also being self-funding.
context_card.formula_readable: Campaign Cost ÷ Dalys Timeline Shift

questions.question_text:
Is the calculation methodology sound for: **Cost per DALY Averted (Timeline Shift)**?

**Current result:** $0.126 per DALY
**Calculation:** CAMPAIGN_COST ÷ DALYS_TIMELINE_SHIFT = $0.126

context.formula_readable: Campaign Cost ÷ Dalys Timeline Shift
context.description: Cost per DALY averted from one-time timeline shift (8.2 years). This is a conservative estimate that only counts campaign cost ($1B) and ignores all economic benefits ($27B/year funding unlocked + $50B/year R&D savings). For comparison: bed nets cost $89.0/DALY, deworming costs $4-10/DALY. This intervention is 700x more cost-effective than bed nets while also being self-funding.

questions.question_text:
Are these input factors appropriate?

**Inputs:**
• Total 1% Treaty Campaign Cost: $1B
• Total DALYs Lost from Disease Eradication Delay: 7.94B DALYs

context.inputs_readable: Total 1% Treaty Campaign Cost, Total DALYs Lost from Disease Eradication Delay
context.formula_readable: Campaign Cost ÷ Dalys Timeline Shift

parameters.display_name: Political Success Probability
parameters.description: Estimated probability of treaty ratification and sustained implementation. Central estimate 1% is ultra-conservative. This assumes 99% chance of failure.

parameters.display_name: Expected Cost per DALY (Risk-Adjusted)
parameters.description: Expected cost per DALY accounting for political success probability uncertainty. Monte Carlo samples from beta(0.1%, 10%) distribution. At the ultra-conservative 1% estimate, this is still more cost-effective than bed nets ($89.0/DALY).

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: Expected cost per DALY accounting for political success probability uncertainty. Monte Carlo samples from beta(0.1%, 10%) distribution. At the ultra-conservative 1% estimate, this is still more cost-effective than bed nets ($89.0/DALY).
context_card.formula_readable: Conditional Cost Per Daly ÷ Political Success Probability

questions.question_text:
Is the calculation methodology sound for: **Expected Cost per DALY (Risk-Adjusted)**?

**Current result:** $13 per DALY
**Calculation:** CONDITIONAL_COST_PER_DALY ÷ 1% = $13

context.formula_readable: Conditional Cost Per Daly ÷ Political Success Probability
context.description: Expected cost per DALY accounting for political success probability uncertainty. Monte Carlo samples from beta(0.1%, 10%) distribution. At the ultra-conservative 1% estimate, this is still more cost-effective than bed nets ($89.0/DALY).

questions.question_text:
Are these input factors appropriate?

**Inputs:**
• Cost per DALY Averted (Timeline Shift): $0.126
• Political Success Probability: 1%

context.formula_readable: Conditional Cost Per Daly ÷ Political Success Probability

parameters.display_name: Treaty ROI - Lag Elimination (PRIMARY)
parameters.description: Treaty ROI based on eliminating the 8.2-year post-safety efficacy lag (PRIMARY METHODOLOGY). Total one-time benefit from disease eradication delay elimination divided by $1B campaign cost. This is the primary ROI estimate for total health benefits.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: Treaty ROI based on eliminating the 8.2-year post-safety efficacy lag (PRIMARY METHODOLOGY). Total one-time benefit from disease eradication delay elimination divided by $1B campaign cost. This is the primary ROI estimate for total health benefits.
context_card.formula_readable: Disease Eradication Delay Total ÷ Campaign Cost

questions.question_text:
Is the calculation methodology sound for: **Treaty ROI - Lag Elimination (PRIMARY)**?

**Current result:** 1.19M ratiox ROI
**Calculation:** DISEASE_ERADICATION_DELAY_TOTAL ÷ CAMPAIGN_COST = 1.19M ratio

context.formula_readable: Disease Eradication Delay Total ÷ Campaign Cost
context.description: Treaty ROI based on eliminating the 8.2-year post-safety efficacy lag (PRIMARY METHODOLOGY). Total one-time benefit from disease eradication delay elimination divided by $1B campaign cost. This is the primary ROI estimate for total health benefits.

parameters.display_name: Expected Treaty ROI (Risk-Adjusted)
parameters.description: Expected ROI for 1% treaty accounting for political success probability uncertainty. Monte Carlo samples POLITICAL_SUCCESS_PROBABILITY from beta(0.1%, 10%) distribution to generate full expected value distribution. Central value uses 1% probability.

progress.note: Estimated time for remaining parameters (3 minutes per parameter)

context_card.what: Expected ROI for 1% treaty accounting for political success probability uncertainty. Monte Carlo samples POLITICAL_SUCCESS_PROBABILITY from beta(0.1%, 10%) distribution to generate full expected value distribution. Central value uses 1% probability.
context_card.formula_readable: Treaty ROI - Lag Elimination (PRIMARY) × Political Success Probability
